case_title: THE DIVISIONAL SUPERINTENDENT, P. W. R., QUETTA vs MIAN MUHAMMAD
appellant: THE DIVISIONAL SUPERINTENDENT, P. W. R., QUETTA

accussed_details.name: Mian Muhammad
allegation: Claim for compensation for injury sustained during employment

facts.respondent_position: Assistant Wireman in P. W. R., Quetta Railway Division

appeal_details.appellant_argument: Medical expenses not covered under Workmen's Compensation Act, 1923

court_findings.reasoning: Medical expenses not covered unless paid by employer during convalescence

final_decision.expectation_from_appellant: Not to recover Rs. 908 from respondent

complaint_summary: Respondent claimed compensation for 60% disability and reimbursement of Rs. 788 spent on medical treatment following an injury sustained during employment.
investigation_summary: The Commissioner for Workmen's Compensation awarded Rs. 788 for medical expenses and compensation for 20% permanent incapacity, totaling Rs. 1908.
judgment_summary: The appeal was partly allowed. The respondent was found not entitled to Rs. 908 spent on medical treatment at C.M.H., Quetta, as it fell outside the scope of the Workmen's Compensation Act, 1923. However, the court expected the appellant not to recover this amount from the respondent due to his financial constraints.
Decision_or_verdict: Appeal partly allowed; Rs. 908 medical expenses disallowed.
legal_arguments: Section 3(1) and Section 4 of the Workmen's Compensation Act, 1923 were analyzed to determine the scope of compensation.
Proviso (a) to Section 4(1) was interpreted to exclude medical expenses unless paid by the employer during convalescence.
Reference to Pakistan Beverage Company v. Ahmad Shah (PLD 1960 Kar. 331) for precedent.
citations: Pakistan Beverage Company v. Ahmad Shah (PLD 1960 Kar. 331)
key_issues: Entitlement to medical expenses under Workmen's Compensation Act, 1923
Interpretation of Section 4 and its proviso
Calculation of compensation for permanent partial disability

legal_terms.Permanent Partial Disability: A condition where an individual suffers a lasting impairment that partially limits their ability to work.
legal_terms.Convalescence: The period of recovery following an illness or injury.

words_and_phrases.Medical Expenses: Costs incurred for medical treatment and related services.
words_and_phrases.Compensation: Monetary award for injury or loss.

summary_vector_notes: The case involves an appeal against compensation awarded under the Workmen's Compensation Act, 1923. The court disallowed Rs. 908 medical expenses claimed by the respondent, citing statutory limitations. The judgment clarified the scope of compensation under Section 4 and its proviso, emphasizing that medical expenses are only recoverable if paid by the employer during convalescence.
